message_1: Consider the space $X = S^1 \vee S^1$ (a figure-eight shape), with basepoint at the intersection of the two circles. Let $p: \widetilde{X}\rightarrow X$ be a covering map, where $\widetilde{X}$ is simply connected. Suppose that $p^{-1}(x_0)$ has 6 elements, where $x_0$ is the basepoint of $X$. Find the fundamental group of $X$.
message_2:
To find the fundamental group of $X = S^1 \vee S^1$, we can use the Seifert-van Kampen theorem. The theorem states that if a space $X$ can be written as the union of two open, path-connected subsets $U$ and $V$ such that $U \cap V$ is also path-connected, then the fundamental group of $X$ can be computed as:

$$\pi_1(X) \cong \pi_1(U) *_{\pi_1(U \cap V)} \pi_1(V)$$

Here, $*$ denotes the free product of groups, and $_{\pi_1(U \cap V)}$ indicates that we are taking the amalgamated free product with respect to the inclusion maps of $U \cap V$ into $U$ and $V$.

In our case, we can choose $U$ and $V$ to be open neighborhoods of the two circles in the figure-eight shape, such that $U \cap V$ is an open neighborhood of the basepoint $x_0$. Since each circle is homeomorphic to $S^1$, we have $\pi_1(U) \cong \pi_1(V) \cong \mathbb{Z}$. Moreover, $U \cap V$ is contractible, so $\pi_1(U \cap V) \cong \{1\}$.

Applying the Seifert-van Kampen theorem, we get:

$$\pi_1(X) \cong \pi_1(U) *_{\pi_1(U \cap V)} \pi_1(V) \cong \mathbb{Z} *_{\{1\}} \mathbb{Z} \cong \mathbb{Z} * \mathbb{Z}$$

The fundamental group of $X$ is the free group on two generators, which can be denoted as $\mathbb{Z} * \mathbb{Z}$ or $F_2$.
